summary: This document is a chain of emails from March 2019 between an FBI Special Agent and a U.S. Attorney's Office contractor regarding the logistics of transferring a large amount of data (hard drives and discs) related to the Epstein case for uploading to a shared system. It indicates active evidence handling during the investigation.

persons.name: I. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: The FBI case agent coordinating the drop-off and pick-up of Epstein case data (hard drives and discs) with a U.S. Attorney's Office contractor.

persons.name: (USANYS) [Contractor]
persons.context: The contractor receiving and uploading Epstein case data to a shared system, coordinating logistics with the FBI agent.

persons.name: M, (USANYS)
persons.context: The AUSA who initiated the request, informing the contractor that the FBI has a large amount of Epstein case data to be uploaded and copied the FBI agent.

connections.description: Coordinating the transfer and upload of Epstein case evidence (hard drives and discs) between law enforcement and the prosecutor's office.
The AUSA copied the FBI agent on an email to facilitate the evidence transfer for the Epstein case.
The AUSA directs the contractor to handle the logistics of uploading Epstein case data provided by the FBI.

events.title: AUSA Requests Data Upload Coordination
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney M emails a contractor, stating the FBI has a large amount of Epstein case data and requests coordination with the FBI case agent for uploading to a shared system.

events.title: Contractor Confirms Data Receipt and Storage
events.description: The contractor confirms that materials on a hard drive and a number of discs have been received and placed in designated locations for the Epstein case.

events.title: FBI Agent Arranges to Retrieve Materials
events.description: The FBI case agent emails the contractor to arrange a time to 'swing by and pick everything back up,' indicating a transfer of physical evidence.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The FBI possessed a 'large amount of data' on the Epstein case as of March 2019, which was being transferred to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The evidence transferred included physical media: at least one hard drive and 'a number of discs.'
The emails show active, routine coordination between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding evidence handling in the Epstein investigation.
The correspondence confirms the Southern District of New York was actively processing Epstein case evidence in early 2019.
